plants.name: Rosa rubiginosa
plants.description: A deciduous shrub native to Europe and western Asia, known for its fragrant pink flowers and aromatic foliage with a scent reminiscent of apples.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to July)
plants.funFact: The leaves of Sweet Briar release a pleasant apple-like fragrance when bruised, a trait uncommon among roses.

plants.name: Lobelia cardinalis
plants.description: A herbaceous perennial native to North America, this plant thrives in moist areas. It produces striking bright red tubular flowers that attract hummingbirds.
plants.bloomingSeason: Mid to late summer (July to September), sometimes starting late June
plants.location: Eastern and Central North America, wetlands and stream banks
plants.funFact: Cardinal Flower is one of the few North American native flowers specialized for hummingbird pollination, using vivid red hues and nectar.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical evergreen shrub widely cultivated worldwide for its large and colorful flowers, commonly seen in warm, frost-free climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates; often in full bloom June onward in warmer zones
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers typically last only a day, but plants produce many blooms throughout the growing season.

plants.name: Nicotiana alata
plants.description: An ornamental plant from South America, appreciated for its fragrant, tubular flowers that often open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to fall (May to October)
plants.location: Native to Brazil and Argentina; widely cultivated in gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Its strong evening fragrance is designed to attract moths, which are its main pollinators.
